intro: Phaca conjuncta, commonly known as the clustered phaca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Phaca conjuncta is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
